body: Looks good to me Dave.
Can one of the committers verify this patch?
Can one of the committers verify this patch?

The test seabase/TEST022 failed possibly because of change in plan when the rows in vanilla hbase table  are deleted. The plan change might have been triggered by the fix for TRAFODION-1633. The delete command works if cqd hbase_delete_costing is turned off. I am running the full regressions in my environment to check if any other tests are failing due to this fix. I might turn off the cqd hbase_delete_costing by default.

All tests passed except seabase/TEST022. Instead of changing the default value of hbase_delete_costing cqd, I will turn it off in the test script. I think the issue might be that the rowset plan is chosen for deletes against native hbase tables.

Selva, there is a JIRA for more detailed info. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-1631.
In a word, assume it has a 3-nodes cluster, node1 ST(system time) 00:00:03, node2 ST 00:00:01 and node3 ST 00:00:02. Now if the DCSMaster start on node1, it will show nothing on DCS UI because DCSServers ST is ahead of DCSMaster. You may know what will happen if DCSMaster starts on node2. Yes, it'll show one DCSServer on DCSUI.

Does Zookeeper sync the times for quorum configuration? If it doesn't and picks up the ctime from the node where the physical open is done, then we may face the same issue. Could you check if ntpd service is running on all nodes ? Maybe coding for tolerating some delta difference might be good.

New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/126/

Thanks Kevin. I should have known to look at the JIRA also.  Such a variation in the time of the nodes forming the cluster can cause all kinds of problems within our software stack and hbase. So, ntpd service is the way to go.

Hi,

Did some more thinking about this, and had the following thought:

We send input logical properties to the right child of the nested join (Context::getInputLogProp()). Those contain a cardinality and a max. cardinality (Context::getInputLogProp()->getMaxCardEst()). Both of these cardinalities should be in the range of the min. and max. cardinality established by constraints.

IMHO it would be better if we would check that max cardinality instead of passing another object down to the right child of the join.

There are multiple other questions I have with the current solution, but first I want to find out whether you are ok with this solution.

Ideally we should guarantee that estimated and max. cardinality should always be within the cardinality boundaries established by constraints (GroupAttr::hasCardConstraint()), but I couldn't find any code that ensures that - maybe I just didn't look carefully enough. Anyway, that could be handled through a separate JIRA, if necessary. For now I would assume that this is the case.

My apologies for being late, I should have thought about it and commented earlier on!
Please do not merge this change while I investigate Hans' suggestion. Thanks.
Roberta answered my concern. Looks good to me.

Arvind, After testing, yes, it'll not impact ctime sequence in Zookeeper even no NTPD service.
Selva, On production, yes, NTPD service is required. But for this obvious issue, i think it should be fixed since it will confuse users that the number of DCS processes doesn't match the number DCS UI without NTPD. It's a no-harm fix and only impacts DCS UI.

Test Failed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/127/

Agreed Kevin that it is a no-harm fix. But, the variation between the time of the nodes can cause lot more problems in hbase. See https://blog.cloudera.com/blog/2011/04/hbase-dos-and-donts/. With Trafodion, we let hbase to add the timestamp  when a row is inserted/deleted/updated. The variation in time impacts in general and more so when the query involves ESP processes running on different nodes. This can cause the rows to disappear or reappear unintentionally. Hence, I feel fixing this issue at DCS level might be no-harm for DCS, but it won't help the overall state of the cluster with the variation in time of the nodes. I would give +0 for this fix tending more towards -1. However I will let other reviewers to decide.

It is good to see this merge passed the minimum requirement. I just glanced through the code and saw there is a lot of rework being done in memory management of T2 driver. Earlier, we had ensured that there is no memory growth when we ran YCSB select and update benchmarks with T2 driver. Can you please work to get these benchmarks done and ensure that there is no memory growth in T2 driver.

Agree with Selva. Better would be to fix the underlying issue by seeing if ntp/ntpd service is running. Fixing just DCS may not indicate that cluster is actually able to tolerate the time difference.

 It might also be helpful to write a utility that checks on $MY_NODES for some tolerance difference between the stat time reported by zookeeper during a dummy node creation and the actual time on the node. This could then flag the nodes that are beyond the tolerance limit and help administrator in fixing the problem.
@ryzuo Do please update this pull request with any latest changes that you might have done/tested to address/follow Steve's suggestions. Thanks.

Thank you for comments. Still have some questions. As you said, it seems NTP is required for Trafodion cluster. SQCHECK/DCSCHECK should check it and if the user dont have one on each node, dont allow to start anything. I got confused. It should not be allowed to start an abnormal cluster. By the way, Cloudera Manager only prints a WARNING message if it doesnt have NTP and doesnt have any abvious mismatching. Sure, if you confirm with it, i'll get back the fixes.

Hi,

I don't have any updates for this PR. Actually I don't think there's necessary that we keep them coexist. The purpose of this change is eliminate the old libs with Nv44 suffix. Although they coexist on my dev machine, but I never used the old ones since I changed this. To make them coexist, we need two edition of the make file and packaging script? Or introduce some env var allow developers to switch between the new and the old? That will be more confusing... So my opinion is we must update our dev environment. Since the traf_tools_setup.sh script is updated as well, I think this won't be a difficult thing to do. Some contributors I know in Shanghai have changed this and keep using it for a while, and run smoothly.

If you really have difficult to update your environments, I think I will have no choice but close this PR...
New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/130/

Hi @ryzuo, I think there is a mis-communication on the point of co-existence of the new/old libraries. As you say there is no need for the new version of code to be able to switch back and forth. There is need, however, for old versions of code to be able to be built/tested on the same machines. 

This is necessary for the transition period so that every workspace on a development machine does not have to update at the same time. More importantly, it is also needed to be able to support an old release of code.

We went through several rounds of trying to have both sets of libraries in the same directory, but a cleaner way will be to just have the new libraries at a different path. Then when the new change comes in it changes where we look for ICU libraries, such as TOOLSDIR/icu44_2.  That enables the old code to coexist on the same machine.

The test failed because DCS_INSTALL_DIR didn't get set properly.

   _**INFO: Start of DCS install
   *__INFO: untarring build file /usr/lib/trafodion/traf_2015-11-24_0223/dcs-1.3.0.tar.gz
   *__INFO: modifying /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cdh/traf_run//conf/dcs-env.sh
   cat: dcs-env.sh: No such file or directory
   *__INFO: modifying /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cdh/traf_run//conf/dcs-site.xml
   cat: dcs-site.xml: No such file or directory
   *__INFO: creating /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cdh/traf_run//conf/servers file
   *_*INFO: End of DCS install.

This pull request has removed the LICENSE file under dcs root directory the following in installer/dcs_installer is returning empty, hence DCS_DIR and subsequently DCS_INSTALL_DIR is not setup properly.

```
# get the dcs install directory name which is imbedded in the tar file
DCS_DIR=$(tar -tf $DCS_BUILD_FILE | grep LICENSE | sed -e "s@\(^.*\)/LICENSE.txt@\1@")
DCS_DIR=$DCS_INSTALL_PATH/$DCS_DIR
```

Can we just use the tar filename to figure out the directory name ? Here are the current files in the root dcs directory:

  -bash-4.1$ cd dcs-1.3.0/
  -bash-4.1$ ls -l
  total 920
  drwxr-xr-x 3 trafodion trafodion   4096 Nov  2 18:51 bin
  drwxr-xr-x 2 trafodion trafodion   4096 Nov  2 18:51 conf
  -rw-r--r-- 1 trafodion trafodion 920659 Nov 24 02:15 dcs-1.3.0.jar
  drwxr-xr-x 5 trafodion trafodion   4096 Nov 24 02:14 dcs-webapps
  drwxr-xr-x 8 trafodion trafodion   4096 Nov 24 02:14 docs
  drwxrwxr-x 2 trafodion trafodion   4096 Nov 24 02:29 lib
  -bash-4.1$
Waiting for what?

Looks good to me, thanks for doing all this work! Good to remove the TPC-D data generator help text. I looked around a bit and it seems the actual (copyrighted) TPC-D generator code was removed before open-sourcing the directory.

Question about DCS_INSTALL_DIR: Shouldn't we phase out this concept, given that DCS now always is located in $MY_SQROOT/../../dcs?

The fix looks ok to me, but after spending an hour or two trying to understand what's going on in MDAM costing I still don't have much of a clue. The code seems nicely structured and modular, but the comments mostly explain what each method does, not what doing that means. What it does I can see from the code, too, but figuring out what it means is much harder. The ColumnOrderList::getSingleSubsetOrderForMDAM() method (file mdam.cpp) seems to allow any range specs in the prefix column. This seems good to me, but it also seems to contradict what the method does with IN lists (which are just another flavor or RangeSpecs). All this may be wrong, due my limited understanding, and it is not directly related to this specific fix.
Is this ready to commit?

Since trafci.sh is a checked-in/versioned file, build step should not modify it. You could follow the same steps as trafci.cmd (144-147) by creating a versioned template file or some other way to avoid the error ( Error: Build modified 1 versioned file(s) ).
